column1: Screening and Risk Factors Report by State
Percent of State Population with 100% Smokefree Bar Laws
All Races (includes Hispanic), Both Sexes, All Ages
Establish laws in States and the District of Columbia on smoke-free indoor air that prohibit smoking in bars
Data not available [http://statecancerprofiles.cancer.gov/datanotavailable.html] for this combination of data selections.
(1) Healthy People 2020 Objectives are managed by the Office of Disease Prevention and Health Promotion, U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

(2) Source: American Nonsmokers' Rights Foundation (January 2, 2020: no-smoke.org ). This table lists the percent of each state's population covered by 100% smokefree air laws enacted by the state and/or local municipalities. Only ordinances and laws currently in effect are listed in the table.
Note: Healthy People 2020 Objectives are age-adjusted to the year 2000 standard population while these estimates are not age-adjusted.
Data for United States does not include Puerto Rico.
